title.native: 新サクラ大戦 the Animation

description:
In 1930, two years after the events of So Long, My Love, the Great Demon War results in the annihilation of the Imperial, Paris and New York Combat Revues' Flower Divisions. With Earth at peace and the revues' actions becoming public, the World Combat Revue Organization is formed with several international divisions; a biennial international Combat Revue tournament has been organized.

Ten years later in 1940, Imperial Japanese Navy captain Kamiyama Seijuurou is assigned as the captain of the new Imperial Combat Revue's Flower Division in Tokyo, which consists of: Amamiya Sakura, a swordswoman and new recruit; Shinonome Hatsuho, a shrine maiden and the most popular actress; Anastasia Palma, a newly-transferred Greek actress; Mochizuki Azami, a ninja prodigy from the Mochizuki clan; and Clarissa "Clarise" Snowflake, a Luxembourgian noblewoman. The division once again faces a new demon invasion and participates in the upcoming tournament – while trying to keep their home at the Imperial Theater open.

(Source: Wikipedia)

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/o_hiroi)

Ouji is an author and video game developer. He's the chairman of the board and representative director of video game studio Red Entertainment and a guest professor at Kanazawa Institute of Technology.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tite_official) | [Official Fanclub](klub-outside.com/s/n136/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fumihilo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

Shouko Fujibayashi is a Japanese lyricist and musician. Shouko has written the lyrics for many television series' theme songs as well as several theme songs for tokusatsu shows. Most recently, Fujibayashi has worked with Shuhei Naruse on the sountracks of Kamen Rider Den-O, Kamen Rider Kiva, and their films respectively. She also worked with BoA, Ken Hirai, Sowelu, Mikuni Shimokawa, Crystal Kay, Beni Arashiro, ISSA of DA PUMP, Lead and Miho Kanno. Shouko made her debut in 1995 with Wonderful Bravo, an image song for the anime TV series, Gokudou-kun. She works for Office Two-One.
Currently works at Atlus. Main character designer for Persona 3 onwards.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itoww)

Artist of the Shakugan no Shana and Suzumiya Haruhi novels and the Bee-Be-Beat it! manga series. Employed under the H-game maker UNiSONSHIFT she has worked on 4 H-games: Nanatsuiro Drops, Alice Parade, Peace@Pieces, and Forget Me Not.
A Japanese video game developer and TV show producer. He is best known for directing the live-action visual novel 428: Shibuya Scramble, which is a prequel to the CANAAN anime.
A Japanese video game developer and TV show producer. He is best known for directing the live-action visual novel 428: Shibuya Scramble, which is a prequel to the CANAAN anime.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nonamehoff)

Hosts "That Anime Show" with J. Michael Tatum

Husband, Stephen Hoff, also works for FUNimation Entertainment

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dochibibi) Yukiko Horiguchi is an animator, illustrator and character designer formerly belonging to Kyoto Animation. She joined Kyoto Animation in 2003 after graduating from a junior college (tanki daigaku). She started as inbetweener on Shin-Chan, before making a debut as key animator on the KyoAni in-house OVA Munto. In 2007 she was given the chance to design characters for the anime adaptation of the Lucky Star yon-koma manga. Horiguchi is particularly known for the shape she gives her drawings, resulting in a certain roundness and the distinctly fine outline and peculiar shading. Her characters appear to be very child-like and cute, and full of energy, which is a major appeal to the fans. The illustrator [BUNBUN](https://anilist.co/staff/112785) is her younger brother.
